TypeSignature.Value: .class public sealed serializable EventHandler extends System.Delegate
public delegate void EventHandler(object sender, EventArgs e);

Docs.param: The object that raised the event.
A instance that contains the event data.

summary.para: Defines the shape of methods that are called in response to an event.

block.para:
A instance is used to specify the methods that are invoked in response to an event. To associate an instance of with an event, add the instance to the event. The methods referenced by the instance are invoked whenever the event is raised, until the
instance is removed from the event.

If the event does not generate data, applications use the base class for the event data object . For more information, see . For additional information about events, see Partitions I and II of the CLI Specification.
